claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers type I interferon signaling and antigen processing.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.
Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination broadens the MHC-I immunopeptidome and improves tumor visibility.

evidence.quote: Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: Prior mRNA vaccination is associated with better survival in patients receiving ICI.

evidence.quote: Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.claim: The sensitization effect is dependent on type I interferon signaling.

evidence.quote: Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.
